title: Setup & Installation
description: Install CLASP and configure your development environment

steps.title: Install Node.js
steps.description: Node.js is required to run CLASP

content.content: CLASP (Command Line Apps Script Projects) runs on Node.js, a JavaScript runtime. If you don't have Node.js installed, you'll need to download and install it first.
**Step 1:** Go to the official Node.js website:
Visit https://nodejs.org and download the LTS (Long Term Support) version - it's the most stable.
**Step 2:** Run the installer and follow the prompts. Accept the default settings.
**Step 3:** Open your terminal (Terminal on Mac, Command Prompt or PowerShell on Windows) and verify the installation:
node --version
You should see a version number like v18.17.0 or higher. If you see an error, try restarting your terminal.
I have Node.js installed and can see a version number

steps.title: Install CLASP
steps.description: Install the CLASP command-line tool globally

content.content: Now that Node.js is installed, we can use npm (Node Package Manager) to install CLASP globally on your computer.
Run this command in your terminal:
npm install -g @google/clasp
The -g flag installs CLASP globally, so you can use it from any folder on your computer.
Verify CLASP is installed:
clasp --version
On Mac/Linux, if you get a permission error, try: sudo npm install -g @google/clasp
CLASP is installed and I can see a version number

steps.title: Enable the Apps Script API
steps.description: Turn on the API that allows CLASP to communicate with Google

content.content: Before CLASP can work with your Google account, you need to enable the Apps Script API in your Google account settings.
**Step 1:** Go to the Apps Script API settings page:
Visit https://script.google.com/home/usersettings
**Step 2:** Find the setting called **"Google Apps Script API"** and make sure it's turned **ON**.
If the API is off, CLASP won't be able to create or push projects to your Google account.
I have enabled the Google Apps Script API

steps.title: Login to Google
steps.description: Authenticate CLASP with your Google account

content.content: Now we need to connect CLASP to your Google account. This lets CLASP create and manage Apps Script projects on your behalf.
Run this command:
clasp login
A browser window will open asking you to sign in to Google and grant permissions. Click through the prompts to authorize CLASP.
Choose the Google account where you want to create your Apps Script projects. This is usually your personal Gmail or Google Workspace account.
After authorizing, you should see a success message in your terminal like: "Authorization successful."
I am logged in to Google via CLASP

steps.title: Create Project Folder
steps.description: Set up your workspace for the Mail List Manager

content.content: Let's create a folder to hold all of your Mail List Manager projects. We'll create sub-folders for each part of the system.
**Step 1:** Open your terminal and navigate to where you want to create the project (like your Documents folder):
cd ~/Documents
**Step 2:** Create the main project folder and navigate into it:
mkdir mail-list-manager && cd mail-list-manager
**Step 3:** Create sub-folders for each part of the project:
mkdir contacts-sheet email-template web-app
**Step 4:** Create a config file to store your project IDs:
echo "# Mail List Manager Configuration" > CONFIG.txt && echo "# Add your IDs here as you complete each project" >> CONFIG.txt

Your folder structure should now look like:
mail-list-manager/
  ├── contacts-sheet/
  ├── email-template/
  ├── web-app/
  └── CONFIG.txt
You're all set up and ready to start building! Your CONFIG.txt file will store important IDs as you complete each project.
I have created my project folders
